page.title: 11Kirkconnel:Traditions Kept
page.content:
In common with most other parts of the U.K. the usual annual festivals are celebrated. Hallowe'en:children dress up in order to conceal their identity and visit the houses of their neighbours and friends.{'Are you hawd'n Hallowe'en?', they ask. If the answer is 'Yes' the children go in and entertain there hosts with a song,poem or joke. More often than not jokes are told which is sad since the true tradition called for more substantial entertainment. The children's efforts are rewarded by the giving of sweets,nuts or fruit. Here again the tradition is being corrupted as more hosts give money rather than home-made sweets etc.
{hawd'n}=holding (keeping or observing) See also page 12
